howItWorks.title: How Cat Pregnancy Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Due Date = Mating Date + 63-65 days (average gestation period)
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator estimates your cat's due date based on the mating date. Cat pregnancy typically lasts 63-65 days, with the calculator showing pregnancy stage and care recommendations.
steps: Enter the date of mating or suspected conception
Click Calculate to see the estimated due date
View the current pregnancy week and stage
Review stage-appropriate care tips

useCases: Planning for kitten arrival and preparing supplies
Scheduling prenatal vet appointments
Understanding pregnancy stages for proper care
Knowing when to prepare the birthing area
seoTips: Cat pregnancy is approximately 9 weeks long
Increase food gradually during the last trimester
Prepare a quiet, warm nesting box before the due date
Watch for nesting behavior as labor approaches
Have emergency vet contact ready near the due date
commonMistakes: Not knowing the exact mating date leading to surprise births
Not increasing food during late pregnancy
Preparing the birthing area too late
Missing signs of labor complications

faqs.question: How long is a cat pregnant?
faqs.answer: Cat pregnancy lasts approximately 63-65 days (about 9 weeks) from conception to birth. This can vary by a few days.

faqs.question: What are signs my cat is pregnant?
faqs.answer: Early signs include enlarged, pinker nipples around week 2-3, increased appetite, weight gain, and behavior changes. A vet can confirm pregnancy around day 20.

faqs.question: How do I prepare for kittens?
faqs.answer: Prepare a quiet, warm nesting box 2 weeks before the due date. Have clean towels, a heat source, and your vet's emergency number ready.

faqs.question: What should I feed a pregnant cat?
faqs.answer: Switch to high-quality kitten food which has extra calories and nutrients. Increase portions gradually in the last trimester as the queen's appetite grows.

faqs.question: When should I call the vet during labor?
faqs.answer: Call if labor lasts more than 24 hours, there's more than 2 hours between kittens, you see green discharge without a kitten, or the cat seems in distress.

dog_pregnancy_calculator.tip_3: Prepare a quiet, comfortable whelping area
dog_pregnancy_calculator.tip_4: Monitor for signs of labor as due date approaches
dog_pregnancy_calculator.empty_state: Enter mating date to calculate pregnancy timeline
dog_pregnancy_calculator.footer_note: Average gestation period is 63 days. Consult your veterinarian for proper care.

howItWorks.title: How Dog Pregnancy Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Due Date = Mating Date + 63 days (average gestation period)
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator estimates your dog's due date and tracks pregnancy stages. Dog pregnancy lasts approximately 63 days, though it can range from 58-68 days depending on breed.
steps: Enter the date of mating or confirmed breeding
Click Calculate to see the estimated due date
View current pregnancy week and stage
Review stage-specific care recommendations

useCases: Planning for puppy arrival and whelping supplies
Scheduling prenatal vet appointments and ultrasounds
Understanding pregnancy stages for optimal care
Preparing whelping area at the right time
seoTips: Dog pregnancy is approximately 9 weeks
Ultrasound can confirm pregnancy around day 25
Nutrition requirements increase in the last trimester
Prepare whelping box 1-2 weeks before due date
Temperature drop signals labor within 24 hours
commonMistakes: Not confirming pregnancy with a vet
Overfeeding too early in pregnancy
Not preparing whelping supplies in advance
Missing signs of labor complications

faqs.question: How long are dogs pregnant?
faqs.answer: Dog pregnancy lasts approximately 63 days (9 weeks) from ovulation. The range is 58-68 days, and larger breeds sometimes go longer.

faqs.question: When can a vet confirm pregnancy?
faqs.answer: Blood tests can detect pregnancy hormones around day 25. Ultrasound works around day 25-30, and X-rays can count puppies after day 45.

faqs.question: What should I feed a pregnant dog?
faqs.answer: Continue regular food for the first 4-5 weeks, then gradually switch to high-quality puppy food. Increase portions by 25-50% in the last trimester.

faqs.question: How do I prepare for whelping?
faqs.answer: Set up a quiet whelping box 2 weeks early. Have clean towels, heating pad, suction bulb, dental floss for cords, and your vet's emergency number ready.

faqs.question: When should I call the vet during labor?
faqs.answer: Call if more than 2 hours pass between puppies, if strong contractions last over 30 minutes without a puppy, or if you see dark green discharge before the first puppy.

pet_medication_dosage_calculator.title: Pet medication dosage calculator - Free Vet Dose Tool
pet_medication_dosage_calculator.description: Calculate medication dose by pet weight accurately. Free online vet drug dosage calculator for dogs and cats.
tips: Only use medications prescribed by a vet
Do not give human medications without consultation
Contact a vet if any abnormal symptoms appear
pet_medication_dosage_calculator.pet_weight_tooltip: Enter your pet's weight in kilograms
pet_medication_dosage_calculator.dosage_per_kg_tooltip: Prescribed dosage amount per kilogram of body weight
pet_medication_dosage_calculator.frequency_tooltip: How often to administer the medication
pet_medication_dosage_calculator.concentration_tooltip: Medication concentration (mg per ml for liquids)
pet_medication_dosage_calculator.empty_state: Enter pet details to calculate dosage
pet_medication_dosage_calculator.footer_note: Always consult a veterinarian for medication dosing. This calculator is for reference only.

howItWorks.title: How Pet Medication Dosage Calculator Works
howItWorks.formula: Dose = Pet weight (kg) × Prescribed dose per kg
howItWorks.explanation: This calculator helps determine medication doses based on your pet's weight and the veterinarian-prescribed dosage rate. Always verify with your vet.
steps: Enter your pet's weight
Enter the prescribed dosage per kilogram
Select administration frequency
Choose medication form (liquid or tablet)
For liquids, enter concentration
View calculated dose amounts

useCases: Calculating medication doses for pets
Converting tablet to liquid dosing
Determining daily total medication amount
Verifying vet-prescribed doses
seoTips: Always use a veterinarian-prescribed dosage
Weigh pets accurately before calculating
Never give human medication without vet approval
Complete full medication course as prescribed
Store medications properly per instructions
commonMistakes: Using human medication dosages for pets
Guessing pet weight instead of weighing
Stopping medication early when pet seems better
Mixing medications without vet approval

faqs.question: Can I give my pet human medication?
faqs.answer: Never give human medication to pets without veterinary guidance. Many human drugs are toxic to animals, and dosages differ significantly.

faqs.question: How do I weigh my pet accurately?
faqs.answer: Weigh yourself, then weigh yourself holding your pet, and subtract. For small pets, use a kitchen scale. Accurate weight is crucial for dosing.

faqs.question: What if I miss a dose?
faqs.answer: Give the missed dose as soon as you remember, unless it's close to the next dose time. Never double up. Contact your vet if unsure.

faqs.question: How do I give liquid medication?
faqs.answer: Use a syringe without a needle. Insert into the side of the mouth, behind the canine teeth. Squirt slowly to avoid choking.

faqs.question: Why is this calculator for reference only?
faqs.answer: Individual pets may have conditions affecting drug metabolism. Only a veterinarian can determine the safe and effective dose for your specific pet.

howItWorks.title: How Pet Medication Dosage Calculator Works

Input the prescribed dosage per kilogram
Select how often the medication should be given
Choose medication form (liquid or tablet)
For liquids, enter the concentration
View the calculated dose per administration

Estimating pet weight instead of measuring
Stopping antibiotics early when pet seems better
Crushing extended-release medications

faqs.question: Why is accurate weight important?
faqs.answer: Pet medication dosages are weight-dependent. Small errors in weight can lead to significant under or overdosing, especially for smaller pets.

faqs.question: Can I give my pet human medication?
faqs.answer: Never without veterinary guidance. Many human medications are toxic to pets. Even safe ones require different dosing than humans.

faqs.question: How do I give liquid medication?
faqs.answer: Use a syringe without a needle. Insert into the side of the mouth, behind the canine teeth. Squirt slowly to avoid choking.

faqs.question: Why is this calculator for reference only?
faqs.answer: Individual pets may have conditions affecting drug metabolism. Only a veterinarian can determine the safe and effective dose for your specific pet.
